body: r_r nuzzles against the fur of {PRONOUN/r_r/poss} dead child, {PRONOUN/r_r/poss} kit, {PRONOUN/r_r/poss} m_c, and feels as though the world has ended.
No parent wants to outlive their child, and r_r wails over m_c's body.
r_r lays next to m_c's body, numb to the world around {PRONOUN/r_r/object}.
r_r feels as though {PRONOUN/r_r/subject}{VERB/r_r/'re/'s} living through a nightmare. m_c, {PRONOUN/r_r/poss} kit, can't really be dead.
When r_r hears the news of m_c's death, {PRONOUN/r_r/subject} {VERB/r_r/collapse/collapses} and {VERB/r_r/wail/wails} as though {PRONOUN/r_r/poss} own life was ending.

m_c had such a bright future ahead of {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. r_r can still hear {PRONOUN/m_c/object} talking about {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} dreams, can still picture {PRONOUN/m_c/object} running through c_n's territory, and to know that m_c will never get the chance to fulfill that. . .

r_r chokes back wails and tears, trying to get to the end of the story {PRONOUN/r_r/subject}{VERB/r_r/'ve/'s} been telling about m_c's days in the nursery. {PRONOUN/r_r/subject/CAP} can do this, {PRONOUN/r_r/subject} can make sure m_c is honored at {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} vigil, even if r_r can't do anything else for {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
